Strange that it's failing in PluginSearchLabelProvider since I was doing a Java 
search.

Adding Dani for comment.
I'm not sure why the java search page would call the pde label provider.

Search keeps the label and content providers for a given search (type) in order
to swap a previous search in. To me it looks like a search bug. If you don't see
a problem on your side please move to Platform Search.

Is this reproducible?

I was not able to reproduce bug 47083, which probably left Nick's search view 
in an inconsistent state.  So I was not able to reproduce this one either.
Moving to Search...
bug 47083 now has better steps to reproduce the problem.

Here's what I think is happening:

1) The plugin label provider is set
2) the search starts
3) we get a notification for added markers (not the ISearchView.setResults()
hasn't been called yet, so fIsNewSearch is false)
4) since fIsNewSearch is false, we don't call handleNewSearchResult is not called.
5) Bang!
This is possible. The search view still assumes that the deltas come in all at once.

Actually, both analyses are correct. We have a problem, too. I found the PDE
problem by hacking the search view to do the label provider, etc. configuration
early.

Fixed the PDE problem by running the search operation in an IWorkspaceRunnable 
with an IWorkspace.AVOID_UPDATE and a null scheduling rule, as suggested by 
Dani.

Moving back to Search to see if Thomas needs to do anything at his end.

Wassim, I was probably not clear enough yesterday on Sametime. What I proposed
is a workaround to make things work for M5 however at the point when even
background search will be supported (probably with M6) the CCE will definitely
hit you.

You need a way to construct a IPluginObject out of IMarker. Note that currently
the API of IMarker.setAttribute(String, Object) is not enforced i.e. you could
store your IPluginObject object into a marker. However, this would be non-API
and could be broken at any time.

The best way is probably a handle approach as we for Java elements.

I recuded it from critical to major and moved the target milestone to 3.0 M6.

And a correction to what I said yesterday: using null as group key does not
group each match into an entry but all matches into one entry.

Dani, you were indeed clear yesterday that this is only a workaround for M5.
As this bug report was marked critical and targeted for M5, I was planning on 
opening a new bug report to rework all pde search work for M6, where I would 
mimic Java search behavior in which I would store enough information on 
IMarker to be able to resurrect an IPluginObject.

With the new M6 target, we could just keep this one open and use it to track 
the work that PDE search needs to do.
java search has been re-implemented - closing
